Articles.Content:
Greetings, fellow Earthlings.

A while ago, I made a 3d render of Kerbin using blender. Recently, I found the old .blend file and improved on it, and I've decided to share it with the KSP community.

The moons and their orbits are all to scale, and are animated as well. Feel free to fiddle around with it as you wish.

Here are a few renders:

 

A WORD OF WARNING:

The textures and .blend file are quite large files, and rendering these images can be a strain on your computer. My computer has a very good graphics board and lots of memory, but I doubt most computers are as well equipped. Suffice to say, I wouldn't recommend downloading this onto a crummy 4-year-old laptop.

 

LICENSE:

This .blend file is licensed under the Creative Commons CC0 Universal Public Domain license (CC0 1.0)

Basically, you can use this .blend file however you want, just don't try to copyright it as your own.

 

Download the files here

 

Enjoy!

Also, feel free to post your renders to this thread. I'd love to see what you guys make!

Edited September 11, 2016 by Third_OfFive
